means: <主美>临时插入的台词（或动作），即兴的音乐，即席的发言（或评论）

sentence.Network_en: I spoke from the pulpit ad lib.
sentence.Network_cn: 我在讲坛上发表即兴演说。

sentence.Network_en: I lost my notes and had to ad - lib the whole speech.
sentence.Network_cn: 我把讲稿丢了,只好临时说了一通.

sentence.Network_en: Throughout the plan she had to ad - lib constantly.
sentence.Network_cn: 在整个计划中,她不得不经常无准备地做.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(A) ... ad-agent 广告代理人 ad-lib 即兴表演 ad-libber 即兴表演者.
GRE逆序_馆档网 ... jib 踌躇不前，停止前进 ad-lib 即兴演唱，临时穿插，信口说出  glib 流利圆滑的，善辩的.
GRE逆序_馆档网 ... jib 踌躇不前，停止前进 ad-lib 即兴演唱，临时穿插，信口说出  glib 流利圆滑的，善辩的.
想挑战即兴演奏(Adlib)的人已有钢琴弹奏经验，但想更自由演奏的人

list.abs: His ad - lib comments showed poor judgment ., 他的即席评论显得缺乏判断力.
ad interim 暂时ad lib 没有限制地ad libitum 随意
常用音乐术语 ... ( rall. ) 渐慢 ( ad lib. ) 速度随意 ( piano ) 弱.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent. (as an adverb): abbreviation of ad libitum

entry.tran: 即兴演出，临时插入（脚本或讲稿中没有的台词）
entry.def: If you ad-lib something in a play or a speech, you say something which has not been planned or written beforehand.

example.ex: He began comically ad-libbing a script...
example.tran: 他即兴调侃起了一段剧本。

example.ex: He's good at ad-libbing his way out of trouble...
example.tran: 他善于为自己妙语解围。

entry.tran: 即兴（或临时插入）的台词
entry.def: An ad-lib is something which is said without having been planned or written beforehand.

example.ex: Every time I fluffed a line Lenny got me out of trouble with a brilliant ad-lib.
example.tran: 每次我台词出错时，伦尼都通过机智的临场发挥帮我解围。

means.word_mean: 1. remark made spontaneously without prior preparation;

sentences.sentence: "his ad-libs got him in trouble with the politicians"
"he extemporized a speech at the wedding"

means.word_mean: 1. said or done without having been planned or written in advance;
2. with little or no preparation or forethought;

auth_sentence.content: Nice try at the weak ad hominem attack though.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nice try at the weak ad hominem attack though.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nice try at the weak ad hominem attack though.

auth_sentence.content: Repeating claims ad infinitum doesn't cut the mustard.
auth_sentence.res_content: Repeating claims ad infinitum doesn't cut the mustard.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Repeating claims ad infinitum doesn't cut the mustard.

auth_sentence.content: The ad isn't just reporting a phony fact.
auth_sentence.res_content: The ad isn't just reporting a phony fact.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The ad isn't just reporting a phony fact.

means.word_mean: 即兴演出；即席讲话；临时插入(剧本中没有的台词等)

sentences.en: The pair have often been known to abandon their script and begin ad-libbing.
sentences.cn: 人所共知，这对搭档常常抛开脚本台词即兴表演起来。

sentences.en: I lost my notes and had to ad-lib the whole speech.
sentences.cn: 我把讲稿丢了，只好临时说了一通。

sentences.en: Throughout the plan she had to ad-lib constantly.
sentences.cn: 在整个计划中，她不得不经常无准备地做。

means.word_mean: <口>临时插入地；随便地；任意地；当场；即席地，即兴地
<主美>临时插入的台词(或动作)；即兴的音乐；即席的发言(或评论)

sentences.en: The speech was full of ad-libs and witty asides.
sentences.cn: 讲演中满是即兴之词和诙谐离题之语。
